name: rave
content:
rave verb [I]
(SPEAK FOOLISHLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to speak in an uncontrolled way, usually because you are upset or angry, or because you are ill: He's always raving (on) about the government. She was ranting and raving about some imagined insult.

(PRAISE)

rave verb [I]
(SPEAK FOOLISHLY)
to speak or shout in a way that is out of control, usually because of anger or mental illness: She was wild and raving, tearing up her books.
rave verb [I]
(SHOW ENTHUSIASM)
infml to express praise and admiration for someone or something enthusiastically: Everyone is raving about that new Vietnamese restaurant.
